**Course Objectives:** This course focuses on developing and advancing students’ verbal and aural communication skills needed in academic settings. Main areas covered in class include: academic listening, critical thinking, critical listening, listening strategies applications and lecture note taking skills. During the semester, students will listen to and watch a variety of authentic visual and audio materials that may include lectures, news clips and documentaries. Furthermore, the course will assist students to become more acquainted with conventional exam testing materials. In sum, the course aims to provide students with advanced listening practices for academic studies and future preparations.

**Grading Criteria**:

•    Attendance, Participation & In-Class Activities 20%     

•    Listening Journals & Interactive Presentation 40%

•    Midterm and Final Exam 40%
